review: I really wanted to like the Chromecast but the device has some serious challenges for anyone who lives in a more populated area.  The devices touts that you can use it with your phone and intro video talks about "casting" your video content to the Chromecast.What it doesn't say is that it is just mirroring content (and not installing an app on the device) which means all content is sent thru your phone or other device to the Chromecast.  (from the internet to your wireless router to the phone (or laptop/pad/netbook) and then back the router to the Chromecast.)  The lack of an installed app creates 2 unnecessary wireless transmissions and bogging down your wireless network and router.  Put yourself in a normal household with a couple of devices running on wireless and you get a device that frequently stops to buffer, or loses connection with the content and you have to start over on your phone to restart the streaming.  It also is a quick drain on your mobile device so it is almost a necessity to have your phone plugged in, another que to a poorly designed device.Since I had wireless devices in the same area (apple tv previously was in the same spot) had no problem with the wireless connectivity and much of our device is wired wherever possible I am not willing to move the router to accommodate such a poorly designed device.  It's going back.
